title: Boy hospitalised following hotel fire
desc: Fire services, ambulance and gardaí were on scene within minutes of the alert being issued.

title: Health ministry records 8 000 malaria cases, 11 deaths in January
desc: %%title%% %%sep%% %%primary_category%% %%sep%% %%sitename%% %%sep%% The Ministry of Health and Social Services has recorded 8 760 cases of malaria and 11 deaths in the northern and north eastern parts of Namibia.

title: John Steenhuisen to withdraw from DA's leadership race
desc: %%title%% %%sep%% %%primary_category%% %%sep%% %%sitename%% %%sep%% Reports are emerging that Democratic Alliance (DA) federal leader John Steenhuisen is set to announce that he will not be available to contest in the party’s leadership race.

title: IOC Session approves consolidated financial statements as at 31 December 2025 and reappointment of PwC as auditor
desc: IOC Members meeting at the 145th Session in Milan, Italy have approved the Consolidated Financial Statements as at 31 December 2025 and reappointed PricewaterhouseCoopers SA (PwC) as the external auditor for 2026.

title: Can India win the T20 World Cup again?
desc: Indian cricket team is getting ready for the big T20 World Cup, which is being played partly in India.

title: Steenhuisen expected to step down as DA leader - reports
desc: The Sunday Times first reported on Tuesday morning that tensions within the DA leadership have led to John Steenhuisen’s decision to step down from the position, citing five DA sources with knowledge of the matter.

title: Study maps highest haemochromatosis risk in Celtic populations
desc: People from the Outer Hebrides and north-west Ireland have the highest risk of developing a genetic disease that causes a dangerous build-up of iron in the body, a study suggests.

title: EU sets world’s first voluntary standard for permanent carbon removals
desc: The Commission has adopted the EU’s first voluntary certification methodologies for permanent carbon removals. Covering DACCS, BioCCS and biochar, the new rules set clear standards, support innovation and investment, and mark the shift from rule-setting to action on the path to climate neutrality.

title: A Hamas Hostage’s Secret Ordeal
desc: Guy Gilboa-Dalal says he was sexually abused by one of his captors in the tunnels of Gaza and threatened with death if he said anything.

title: PolyU develops novel antibody targeting fat cell protein, offering new approach to treating metabolism
desc: HONG KONG SAR - Media OutReach Newswire - 3 February 2026 - Liver cancer is one of the three deadliest cancers worldwide, and metabolic dysfunction-related cases have become increasingly common in recent years. A research team from The Hong Kong Polytechnic University (PolyU) has identified a protein secreted by fat…
